command line¶

json_tabularize is most conveniently used from the command line. You can run the package directly like so:: ```{sh}

C:/Users/mjols/Python39> python -m json_tabularize counties.json

[
{

“state”: “Florida”, “shortname”: “FL”, “info.governor”: “Rick Scott”, “counties.name”: “Dade”, “counties.population”: 12345

}, {

“state”: “Florida”, “shortname”: “FL”, “info.governor”: “Rick Scott”, “counties.name”: “Broward”, “counties.population”: 40000

}, {

“state”: “Florida”, “shortname”: “FL”, “info.governor”: “Rick Scott”, “counties.name”: “Palm Beach”, “counties.population”: 60000

}, {

“state”: “Ohio”, “shortname”: “OH”, “info.governor”: “John Kasich”, “counties.name”: “Summit”, “counties.population”: 1234

}, {

“state”: “Ohio”, “shortname”: “OH”, “info.governor”: “John Kasich”, “counties.name”: “Cuyahoga”, “counties.population”: 1337

}

]¶
